title: Plastic straws to be banned in England from Thursday : r/worldnews - Reddit
body: 5.9K votes, 472 comments. 33M subscribers in the worldnews community. A place for major news from around the world, excluding US-internal news.
readable_content:
- King_O_Rap (2020-12-08): Plastic straws to be banned in England from Thursday
- HopeFox (2020-12-08): Any word on fishing nets?
- BlueFootedTpeack (2020-12-08): tbf can't remember the last place i saw plastic straws, then again i haven't been to a restaurant in months either.
- WickedLilThing (2020-12-08): cool, now do something about the rest of the single use plastics.
- TazocinTDS (2020-12-08): Looking forward to all the posts saying this is the last straw
- CMG30 (2020-12-08): I'd ban cigarette butts before plastic straws. At least people seem to feel bad about throwing a plastic straw on the ground.
summary: The conversation about banning plastic straws seems to be generally positive, with some users expressing support for the ban and others highlighting the need to address other single-use plastics as well. Overall, there is acknowledgment of the environmental impact of single-use plastics. Sentiment: 0.6
